claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.

rejected_evidence.quote: because it is not subject to mutations to the A (H3N2) glycosylation binding site that reduce the effectiveness of egg based vaccines.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote directly supports the claim by stating that Flublok (RIV4) is not subject to mutations that occur in egg-based vaccines, which can alter the antigenic match to WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains. This implies that Flublok maintains the intended antigenic match.
This quote clarifies that RIV4 refers to Flublok, ensuring that statements about RIV4 in the document apply specifically to Flublok and its manufacturing process.

rejected_evidence.quote: b RIV4: Flublok. c SD-IIV4: Afluria, Fluarix, FluLaval, Standard Dose Flu zone and FlucelVax.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote explicitly identifies RIV4 as Flublok, which is a recombinant vaccine. Recombinant vaccines like Flublok are manufactured without eggs and are designed to match the WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains exactly, supporting the claim of identical antigenic match.
